content:
I've gotten multiple complaints that having two setting icons on the desktop app is confusing and not user friendly.
One suggestion is to follow what slack does:

  • No global settings icon of any kind.
  • setting panels/menus are only accessible via drop-down menus.

  • each conversation has a conversation settings menu that links to some helpful things, such as [this]( dkpvq8cuKzeC_slack_2018-09-24_10-19-311.jpg for myself.

  • I actually think this is a good idea to just get rid of the settings icons alltogether, because unlike slack, zulip desktop app has the familar File|Edit|View| etc... dropdown native menus. (at least on windows)

At the very least, I was told that the hover descriptions Menu and Settings are too vague. It seems like a sloppy job.

I actually think this is a good idea to just get rid of the settings icons alltogether, because unlike slack, zulip desktop app has the familar File|Edit|View| etc... dropdown native menus. (at least on windows)

@Yoshi Goto I don't think it's a good idea. In the Zulip app, there are a dozen app settings and that's why we need a dedicated setting page. Slack only have a few setting options and it doesn't let you customize the app behaviour much.
Also, we can't put all these settings in the Menu item since we can't have the multiple options, descriptions etc there.

At the very least, I was told that the hover descriptions Menu and Settings are too vague. It seems like a sloppy job.

Yeah, this could be improved. We can rename Settings to Desktop app settings or something to make it clear.

@Akash Nimare what I mean is that there should be dropdown menu item called Settings, which opens to Desktop App Settings, Zulip Settings, Organization settings, etc...
or some form of this.
Hmm, I think we could append Desktop App Settings in the gear menu, something like this -
pasted image
Thanks for reminding me of this. I had this idea before but somehow forgot and missed :slight_smile:

There is a issue with this though. Then the desktop settings would be accessible only from within a realm.
There are several settings that one may access before adding any organization like the proxy settings. For these cases we'd need a separate settings option or include it in the add server page as well.
@Abhigyan Khaund the Setting icon in the left-sidebar is not going anywhere, we'll just add the same button in web app's gear menu.
That sounds fine then. Shouldn't be much difficult. Can also be implemented at the web app level itself, using electron bridge existence I think.
Yeah, we need to add it on webapp level.

I agree having two gear menus is confusing, or at least two gear menu icons, and I think that's the problem Yoshi wanted to solve.
I would suggest

  • Adding items to the native menus like Preferences, Network, Add organization, etc
  • Maybe add something to the left sidebar of https://chat.zulip.org/#settings
  • Removing the gear menu from the left sidebar
I agree it can be confusing. But I believe a lot of people (at least me) would prefer an easier access to all the settings then going through the native menus for it.

Having two gear menu icons I think is not an option though long term.
The settings are also not something you need to access after the initial onboarding.
